intro: Aciotis aequatorialis, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Aciotis aequatorialis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
